scene_metadata.title: The Paradox of Seeking
scene_metadata.philosophical_depth: the middle way between chasing and waiting

dialogue.text: *fidgeting with nervous energy* Listen? But I can't just sit here. I touched something real. More real than this chair, this room...
*slight smile* I know. The hardest teaching: don't chase what you most want to find. But...
*leaning forward* But what? There has to be something I can do. Some way to... to court it, if not chase it.

visual_elements.architect_shift: Moving from mythic to practical mode

psychological_notes: Evan embodies the classic spiritual paradox - the need to seek what can only be found through not seeking. His request to 'court' rather than 'chase' shows growing wisdom. The architect recognizes when philosophical wisdom must give way to practical method.
philosophical_underpinning: The middle way acknowledges both the futility of grasping and the necessity of practice
therapeutic_direction: Meeting the client's need for agency while maintaining wisdom about non-attachment
